title: Division of Bass (state)
text:
The electoral division of Bass is one of the <a href="Tasmanian%20House%20of%20Assembly%20electoral%20divisions">five electorates</a> in the <a href="Tasmanian%20House%20of%20Assembly">Tasmanian House of Assembly</a>, it includes north-east Tasmania and <a href="Flinders%20Island">Flinders Island</a>. Bass takes its name from the British <a href="ship%27s%20doctor">naval surgeon</a> and explorer of Australia: <a href="George%20Bass">George Bass</a>. The division shares its name and boundaries with the <a href="division%20of%20Bass">federal division of Bass</a>.
Bass and the other House of Assembly electoral divisions are each represented by five members elected under the <a href="Hare-Clark%20electoral%20system">Hare-Clark electoral system</a>.
History and electoral profile.
Bass was created in 1909 and includes the city of <a href="Launceston%2C%20Tasmania">Launceston</a> and towns in the states north east including: <a href="Scottsdale%2C%20Tasmania">Scottsdale</a>, <a href="Lilydale%2C%20Tasmania">Lilydale</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Tasmania">St Helens</a>, <a href="George%20Town%2C%20Tasmania">George Town</a> and others.
